intro: Daphne jejudoensis, commonly known as Jeju daphne, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Jeju in South Korea. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a leathery texture, while its stems are usually covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
